content.description:
Begin with high foot, left hand on undercling and right hand on crimp. Climb upward to nice crimp and finish with a big move and commit to the sketchy slab top out.

Start is difficult for shorter people and the last committing move is the crux. Stacking pads will make the starting move much much easier.

Can be top roped. A bolt was added at the top. Can use the bolt and boulder at the top to build an anchor.

*Anchor is one bolt and small boulder. Use static rope for Top R. And don't just use one bolt.*

^Thanks Gavin Bridgman.
content.location:
The northern most portion of the east face of the large boulder just down hill of the Lion's Mane.

33.676075, -117.117313

content.description:
Begin just around the right arete  on side pull and pinch. Traverse leftward with a couple big reaches, crimps, side-pulls, and pussy cat foot work until you thumb press upward on long rail-undercling.

Two to three movies can be added to either end of this traverse likely making it a V4-V5.
content.protection: if you want a pad, the highest off the ground will be about 3 feet.
content.location: On the southern face of the large Thundercat! boulder.
